text: caramel, toast, leather, woody, vanilla, warm cherry red fruit sweetness. Lovely.
Present from my grandson, tasted as a pair, very nice combination of a delicious old ale and delicious sherry, this for me is fantastic.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2016 Bottle at home.... Dark black... Thick tan head... Dark dry chocolate roast malts nose... Dark sweet toffee chocolate fruit.. Juicy malts.. Madira tones.. Sweet sherry... Juicy fruits... Big sweet fruit.. Juicy sherry fruit... Superb
Bottle at home. Pours deep brown, nose is vanilla, toffee, marzipan, caramel, taste is sweet, chewy toffee, fruity, little more marzipan.

Intense, sweet caramel, burnt molasses, dark, toasted malts, prunes, figs. Hazy, dark brown, big, creamy, beige head. Creamy caramel malts continue, dark fruits, ripe prunes, dried dark berries, molasses, notes of rich, sweet wood, soft carbonation, full bodied, more sweet malts and dark fruits in the finish. Beautiful Old Ale, immensely rich and complex. Bottle from Hop Locker, Waterloo.

Bottle. Beer Central, Sheffield. Hazy, deep chestnut brown. Ring and film of lasting, tan head. Nose has raisins. Dried fig. Sweet red grape. Hint of cocoa. Hint of caramel. All of which pairs beautifully with the Fino barrel, giving a dry, vinous tang. Taste is ripe and fruity sweet. Some woody dryness. Smooth, light to medium body. Soft carbonation. Some vinous tang. Finishes with a sweet, vinous, woody, light bitterness. Lovely.

Bottle from Hops & Crafts Exeter. Pours dark ruby with a big beige head. Aroma is slighly vinious,fruit,raisins,berries,chocolate & sherry notes. Taste is slighly vinious with red grapes,sherry,oak,chocolate & sugar. Light to medium bodied,smooth, slighly dry the finish is slighly vinious ,sherry ,grape ,raisin,oak,dark malt & chocolate . A good old ale . Thou I wanted it to be more vinious!

Bottle from Cornelius. Pours dark brown with beige head. Nose is dried fruits, raisins, notes of red wine, sherry, light roast, sweet red fruits. Very tempting if vinous notes do not scare you. Taste follows nose albeit does not get all the way there. Dates, dried fruits, sherry and vinous notes, warming alcohol, light chocolate. Good balance, complex yet easy to drink. I like what the barrel does here but not all will - vinous notes are quite dominant. Excellent beer and sold without premium "barrel price".

Bottle to a pint while visiting Skye. Deep mahogany brown with tan head. Roasted malt, toffee and spices. Balanced with dark fruit, raisins and sweet sherry notes... Excellent!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of dates, figs, raisins, muscovado, light chocolate. Taste is sweet and vinous with a very mild alcohol bitter finish. Medium to full bodied and smooth with soft carbonation.
